description: Borrowed from Middle French ministeriel. Doublet of minstrel and ministerialis.

adjectives.description: ministerial (comparative more ministerial, superlative most ministerial)

entries.meaning: Related to a religious minister or ministry.
Related to a governmental minister or ministry.
Having the power to wield delegated executive authority.
(especially law) Serving as an instrument or means (i.e., procedural or ancillary, not substantive).
examples: Filling out the form under the direction of a lawyer is a ministerial task performed by a legal secretary.

entries.meaning: (historical) A member of the mediaeval estate or caste of unfree nobles.
